name: Easy Chicken Cordon Bleu
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Butterfly each chicken breast and open it like a book.
Brush the inside with Dijon mustard, then season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and smoked paprika.
Layer 2 slices of ham and a slice of fresh mozzarella inside each breast.
Fold closed and secure with toothpicks or kitchen twine.
Brush the outside of the chicken with olive oil or melted butter.
Coat each chicken breast in panko breadcrumbs.
Place on prepared baking sheet and bake for 25–30 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let rest for 5 minutes before serving. Remove toothpicks or twine before plating.

storage_tips.room_temp: Not recommended for storage at room temperature.
storage_tips.freezing_cookies: Wrap cooked chicken tightly and freeze for up to 2 months. Reheat in the oven at 350°F (175°C) until warmed through.

optional: kitchen brush for mustard or oil
